data.title: House of the Dragon Season 2: Episode schedule, release date, returning cast and plot
meta_keywords: House of the Dragon Season 2 episode schedule
data.meta_description: House of the Dragon gears up for its grand return. Following the explosive season finale nearly two years ago, the Game of Thrones prequel will premiere its second season on June 16.
data.text:
Synopsis

House of the Dragon gears up for its grand return. Following the explosive season finale nearly two years ago, the Game of Thrones prequel will premiere its second season on June 16.

Anticipation runs high as the much-loved series, House of the Dragon, prepares to make a grand return. Following the explosive season finale nearly two years ago, the prequel to Game of Thrones will premiere its second season on June 16.

Based loosely on George R.R. Martin's Fire & Blood, the series explores the Targaryen dynasty 200 years before the events of Game of Thrones. Returning stars include Emma D'Arcy, Olivia Cooke, Matt Smith, and Fabien Frankel, alongside newcomers Abubakar Salim, Gayle Rankin, and Freddie Fox.

Premiere Details

House of the Dragon Season 2 will premiere on Sunday, June 16, at 9 p.m. EST and PST on HBO, with streaming available on Max, as mentioned in a report by Cosmopolitan. Viewers can subscribe to the standard plan for $9.99 per month or opt for an ad-free experience at $16.99 per month.

Episode Schedule

Unlike its predecessor, Season 2 will consist of eight episodes instead of ten. The release schedule is as follows:

Episode 1: Sunday, June 16

Episode 2: Sunday, June 23

Episode 3: Sunday, June 30

Episode 4: Sunday, July 7

Episode 5: Sunday, July 14

Episode 6: Sunday, July 21

Episode 7: Sunday, July 28

Episode 8 (Season Finale): Sunday, August 4

New Faces and Characters

Season 2 promises not only a continuation of the intense power struggles but also the introduction of new characters and story arcs, as per the Cosmopolitan report.

New additions to the cast include Clinton Liberty as Addam of Hull, Jamie Kenna as Ser Alfred Broome, Kieran Bew as Hugh, Tom Bennett as Ulf, Tom Taylor as Lord Cregan Stark, Vincent Regan as Ser Rickard Thorne, Abubakar Salim as Alyn of Hull, Gayle Rankin as Alys Rivers, Freddie Fox as Ser Gwayne Hightower, and Simon Russell Beale as Ser Simon Strong.

Plot Expectations

This season will explore the Targaryen civil war, a conflict that threatens to tear the Seven Kingdoms apart. The battle's outcome will determine the successor to the Iron Throne, setting the stage for the eventual decline of the Targaryen reign. The narrative will focus on the internal strife within the kingdom, promising an intense and gripping season.

Future Prospects

The excitement doesn't end with Season 2. HBO has already renewed House of the Dragon for a third season, indicating the network's confidence in the show's ongoing success. Fans can look forward to even more dragon-filled drama and intricate political maneuvering in the future.

FAQs

Where can I watch season 2 of House of the Dragon?

“House of the Dragon,” based on George R.R. Martin's “Fire & Blood,” is an HBO Original. This means the show will air exclusively on HBO and be available to stream on Max.

What book is season 2 House of Dragon?

While "Game of Thrones" is based on George R.R. Martin's "A Song of Ice and Fire" series, "House of the Dragon" is based on "Fire & Blood." This book, attributed to an Archmaester of Westeros, provides a detailed history of the Targaryen reign.
